name: Emotion Faces Game
description: Draw or print different emotion faces (happy, sad, angry, scared, excited). Have child match emotions to situations or act them out. Helps with emotional identification.

name: Calm Down Jar (Glitter Jar)
description: Fill a clear jar with water, glitter glue, and glitter. When upset, child shakes jar and watches glitter settle while taking deep breaths. Visual aid for self-regulation.

name: Turn-Taking Board Games
description: Play simple board games like Candy Land, Chutes and Ladders, or Hi Ho Cherry-O. Practice waiting for turns, winning gracefully, and losing without tantrums.

name: Feelings Thermometer
description: Create a visual thermometer (1-10 scale) to help child identify intensity of emotions. Use colors (green=calm, yellow=worried, red=very upset). Check in daily.

name: Cooperative Building
description: Build something together using blocks, Legos, or cardboard boxes. Must work as a team with each person adding pieces. No competition, just creation.

name: Breath Buddies
description: Child lies down with stuffed animal on belly. Watch the 'buddy' rise and fall with deep breaths. Count 4 in, hold 4, out 4. Makes breathing exercises fun.

name: Sharing Practice with Timer
description: Use a visual timer for sharing toys. Each child gets the toy for set time (3-5 min). Timer makes turn-taking concrete and reduces conflicts.

name: Worry Box
description: Decorate a box together. When worried, child writes/draws worry and puts it in box. Set time to 'check worries' together. Externalizes anxiety.

name: Freeze Dance
description: Play music and dance. When music stops, freeze in place. Great for impulse control and following directions while having fun.

name: Compliment Circle
description: Family sits in circle. Each person gives genuine compliment to person next to them. Builds positive communication and self-esteem.
